bugs.title: golang-cloud-google: FTBFS in Fedora rawhide/f39

bugzilla.short_desc: golang-cloud-google: FTBFS in Fedora rawhide/f39

long_desc.thetext: Fail to build from source tracker for Fedora 39

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 39 development cycle.
Changing version to 39.

Fedora 40 Fail To Build From Source Tracker

Reproducible: Always

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 39 development cycle.
Changing version to 39.

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 40 development cycle.
Changing version to 40.

golang-cloud-google failed to build from source in Fedora rawhide/f39

https://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/taskinfo?taskID=103586644


For details on the mass rebuild see:

https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_39_Mass_Rebuild
Please fix golang-cloud-google at your earliest convenience and set the bug's status to
ASSIGNED when you start fixing it. If the bug remains in NEW state for 8 weeks,
golang-cloud-google will be orphaned. Before branching of Fedora 40,
golang-cloud-google will be retired, if it still fails to build.

For more details on the FTBFS policy, please visit:
https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/fesco/Fails_to_build_from_source_Fails_to_install/

Created attachment 1977981
build.log

file build.log too big, will only attach last 32768 bytes

Created attachment 1977982

file root.log too big, will only attach last 32768 bytes

Created attachment 1977983
state.log

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora Linux 39 development cycle.
Changing version to 39.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-40611 golang-cloud-google: Apache Airflow: Dag Runs Broken Access Control Vulnerability [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-40611 golang-cloud-google: Apache Airflow: Dag Runs Broken Access Control Vulnerability [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-40611 Apache Airflow: Dag Runs Broken Access Control Vulnerability

long_desc.thetext:
Apache Airflow, versions before 2.7.1, is affected by a vulnerability that allowsauthenticated and DAG-view authorized Users to modify some DAG run detail values when submitting notes. This could have them alter details such as configuration parameters, start date, etc.

Users should upgrade to version 2.7.1 or later which has removed the vulnerability.

https://lists.apache.org/thread/8y9xk1s3j4qr36yzqn8ogbn9fl7pxrn0
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/33413

Created golang-cloud-google tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238618]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2238617

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2238617,2238618

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057

FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057 has been pushed to the Fedora 40 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-40712 golang-cloud-google: Apache Airflow: Secrets can be unmasked in the "Rendered Template" [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-40712 golang-cloud-google: Apache Airflow: Secrets can be unmasked in the "Rendered Template" [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-40712 Apache Airflow: Secrets can be unmasked in the "Rendered Template"

long_desc.thetext:
Apache Airflow, versions before 2.7.1, is affected by a vulnerability that allows authenticatedusers who have access to see the task/dag in the UI, to craft a URL, which could lead to unmasking the secret configuration of the task that otherwise would be masked in the UI.

Users are strongly advised to upgrade toversion 2.7.1 or later which has removed the vulnerability.

https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/33516
https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/33512
https://lists.apache.org/thread/jw1yv4lt6hpowqbb0x4o3tdp0jhx2bts

Created golang-cloud-google tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2238620]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2238619

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2238619,2238620

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-41267 golang-cloud-google: apache-airflow: Apache HDFS Provider error message suggested installation of incorrect pip package [fedora-38]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-41267 golang-cloud-google: apache-airflow: Apache HDFS Provider error message suggested installation of incorrect pip package [fedora-38]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-41267 apache-airflow: Apache HDFS Provider error message suggested installation of incorrect pip package

long_desc.thetext:
In the Apache Airflow HDFS Provider, versions prior to 4.1.1, a documentationinfo pointed users to an install incorrect pip package. As this package name was unclaimed, in theory, an attacker could claim this package and provide code that would be executed when this package was installed. The Airflow team has since taken ownership of the package (neutralizing the risk), and fixed the doc strings in version 4.1.1


https://github.com/apache/airflow/pull/33813
https://lists.apache.org/thread/ggthr5pn42bn6wcr25hxnykjzh4ntw7z

Created golang-cloud-google tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2238984]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2238983

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2238983,2238984

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057

If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: Please update golang-cloud-google to latest

bugzilla.short_desc: Please update golang-cloud-google to latest

long_desc.thetext:
golang-google-{grpc, genproto} are dependent on a significant number of missing import paths compared to current Fedora version

I'm not really familiar or sure about how upstream is versioned, so I will try to assemble a PR, but if possible to update it would be very helpful

Reproducible: Always

golang-cloud-google moved to modular releases, similar to what Azure is doing with their SDK. The issue is that they import path did not change compared with what Azure did. 

Help to build updated packages is welcome and the approach used for Azure's specs can be used for Google.
thanks for the quick and helpful response - will try to schedule some time to work on pushing this along in the next couple weeks
FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 40. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057

FEDORA-2023-f23d9c5057 has been pushed to the Fedora 40 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.
